sen.j: 散曲（さんきょく）とは、曲の一種であり、口語による韻文形式または歌謡文芸の一つ。
sen.e: Sankyoku is a kind of music (qu) and a form of poetry in the spoken language and is also literature of songs and ballads.

sen.j: 元 (王朝)・明・清代に隆盛した。
sen.e: It flourished during the Yuan, Ming and Qing Dynasties.

sen.j: 「散套」（さんとう：散曲套数の略、単に套数とも言われる）と「小令」（しょうれい：詞の小令とは異なる）の2種類がある。
sen.e: There are two kinds; one is 'Santo' (short form of Sankyoku-tosu, also simply called Tosu [taoshu in Chinese]) and the other is 'Shorei' ([xiaoling in Chinese) different from Shorei of ci, another type of literature)
sen.cmt: 中国語では 套数はtaoshu、小令はxiaoling

sen.j: 「散套」は同一の宮調を用いて構成された組歌形式のものであり、長短不揃いで押韻は一韻到底であった。
sen.e: 'Santo' is a suite form of poetry composed of the same scales (gongdiao in Chinese), in which major and minor are irregular and a single rhyme is used through the poem.

sen.j: 雑劇の歌詞と性質を同じくし、作家が重複することもしばしばであった。
sen.e: It is the same as with lyrics in zaju (Chinese classical theatrical play) in nature, and so oftentimes a writer wrote lyrics for both.

sen.e: Shorei' is short and independent melodies but possible to be composed.

sen.j: また2・3の曲調で構成される「帯過曲」があるが、これは小令の一体として分類されている。
sen.e: There is also another kind, 'taikakyoku' (daiquoqu in Chinese), composed of two or three melodies, but it is categorized as part of shorei.

sen.j: 雑劇とともに元代に隆盛し、総称して元曲と言われる。
sen.e: Sankyoku (sanqu) flourished along with Zaju in the Yuan Dynasty, therefore they are called yuanqu as the general term.

sen.j: 馬致遠の「借馬」、姚守中の「牛訴冤」、睢景臣の「高祖還郷」、劉致の「上高監司」といった作品が有名。
sen.e: Works as 'Majie' by Ma Zhiyuan, 'Niu Suyuan' by Yao Shouzhong, 'Gaozu Huanxiang' by Sui Jingchen and 'Shanggao jiansi' by Liu Zhi are famous.

sen.j: 多く雑曲と作家が共通するが、散曲だけの作家に張可久、貫雲石らがいる。
sen.e: In many cases writers are in common to Zaju, but some writers like Zhang Kejiu and Guan Yunshi wrote only for Sankyoku.
sen.cmt: 雑曲ではなく雑劇ではないかと解釈しました。
sen.e: In many cases, the same writer writes both sankyoku and zakkyoku, but some writers like Zhang Kejiu and Guan Yunshi wrote only sankyoku.
